skill.name: docs
skill.description: Research documentation, find examples, explain APIs and libraries - Use when you need to look up official documentation, find code examples, understand library APIs, or research best practices.
skill.summary: Research documentation, find examples, explain APIs and libraries - Use when you need to look up off...
skill.author: 0xSero

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only system prompt configuration and metadata. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities. All 13 static findings are false positives triggered by documentation content describing library usage examples, not actual code that performs network requests or crypto operations.

content.value_statement: Finding and understanding documentation across libraries and frameworks takes significant time and effort. This skill provides accurate references and clear explanations by guiding the AI to prefer official documentation, highlight version-specific details, and provide concrete usage examples.
actual_capabilities: Research official documentation across libraries and frameworks
Find concrete code examples for common use cases
Explain APIs with minimal jargon and clear examples
Summarize key points before providing detailed references
limitations: Cannot browse the internet or fetch live documentation
Cannot verify if documentation is current or outdated
Cannot access proprietary or private documentation behind authentication

use_cases.title: Quick API reference lookups
use_cases.description: Get clear explanations and examples for library functions without leaving your coding workflow

use_cases.title: Learn programming concepts
use_cases.description: Understand framework APIs with beginner-friendly explanations and version-aware guidance

use_cases.title: Verify official specifications
use_cases.description: Cross-reference behavior with canonical documentation to ensure accuracy in your own documentation

prompt_templates.title: Find basic syntax
prompt_templates.scenario: Looking up how to use a function
prompt_templates.prompt: Look up the official documentation for [library/package] function [function_name] and explain how to use it with a short example.

prompt_templates.title: Version differences
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain what changed between [version A] and [version B] for [library/function]. Highlight any breaking changes.

prompt_templates.title: Best practices
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the recommended best practices for using [library/framework] according to the official docs?

prompt_templates.title: Complex workflows
prompt_templates.prompt: Find documentation on how to implement [specific workflow] using [library]. Show an example from the official docs.

output_examples.input: Look up how to use Python's requests library to make a GET request with custom headers.
output: Use requests.get(url, headers=custom_headers) to send a GET request with headers
Headers should be a dictionary with string keys and values

output_examples.input: Find documentation for React useState hook and explain basic usage.
output: useState initializes state in functional components
Returns an array with state value and setter function

output_examples.input: What are the main changes in Django 4.0 compared to 3.2?
output: Redis is now required for caching sessions
Template-based widget rendering is now the default

best_practices: Ask for specific versions when working with version-sensitive libraries
Request code examples that match your use case (async vs sync, error handling, etc.)
Follow up with questions about edge cases or error handling for production code
anti_patterns: Asking for documentation without specifying a version can lead to incorrect answers
Requesting very old documentation without version context may produce outdated guidance
Assuming all libraries follow the same patterns across different versions

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for documentation lookup and explanation tasks.

faq.question: How current is the documentation knowledge?
faq.answer: The skill guides the AI to prefer official docs, but the AI's knowledge depends on its training data cutoff date.

faq.question: Can this skill access private or enterprise documentation?
faq.answer: No, this skill cannot access documentation behind authentication walls or private repositories.

faq.question: Is my code or data stored when using this skill?
faq.answer: No, this is a prompt-based skill with no file system or network access. No data leaves your session.

faq.question: Why does the AI sometimes not know the latest version of a library?
faq.answer: The AI's knowledge is limited by its training data cutoff date. Always verify with official sources for recent releases.

faq.question: How is this different from asking the AI directly?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured guidance to prioritize official documentation, version awareness, and clear examples.
